H0.text: what form of currency does china have. Yuan

H1.text: what form of currency does china have. Chinese Dollar

H2.text: what form of currency does china have. Dragon Dollar

H3.text: what form of currency does china have. Renminbi

A4.text: The renminbi (Chinese: 人民币; pinyin: Rénmínbì; lit. 'People's Currency' Chinese pronunciation: [ʐən˧˥min˧˥pi˥˩]; symbol: ¥; ISO code: CNY; abbreviation: RMB) is the official currency of China.

A5.text: The Chinese yuan (元) is the basic unit of the renminbi.

A7.text: Historical and current banknotes of the People's Republic of China.

A8.text: A new yuan was introduced in 1955 at a rate of 10,000 old yuan = 1 new yuan, known as the renminbi yuan.

A9.text: This was effectively the world's first international currency, beginning to circulate widely in east and southeast Asia in the late 18th century due to Spanish presence in the region, principally the Philippines and Guam.

A10.text: The renminbi is the world's fifth-most-traded currency as of April 2022.

A11.text: As the Chinese Communist Party took control of ever larger territories in the latter part of the Chinese Civil War, its People's Bank of China began to issue a unified currency in 1948 for use in Communist-controlled territories.
